data.question: What is the empirical formula of the 3D zinc formate framework discussed?
What method was used to measure the Young's modulus (E) and hardness (H) of the framework?
At what pressure did the crystals of the framework crack and transform to a monoclinic phase?
Is the indentation modulus obtained from nanoindentation of a single crystal represented as an 'indentation modulus'?
Does the nanoindentation experiment reveal that the framework is more compliant and deforms more along the b axis compared to the c axis?
Was the computational study performed using the CP2K-QuickStep program at the GGA-DFT level?
What was the purpose of using a Berkovich tip in the nanoindentation experiments?
data.answer: To determine the Young's modulus (E) and hardness (H) of the framework

data.question: Why was the crystal polished off to get an artificial facet {010}?
data.answer: Because the blocky crystal did not have any natural facet perpendicular to the major facet {002}

data.question: What was the role of the ruby chip in the high-pressure experiments?
data.answer: It was used as a pressure calibrant

data.question: Did the high-pressure X-ray single-crystal diffraction data collection extend up to 1.35 GPa?
Was the indentation stress at an angle of 90 degrees with respect to two of the formate ligands while indenting along the b axis?
Is the indentation modulus for isotropic materials expected to be the same as for anisotropic materials?
What was the crystal system of the framework at ambient pressure?
What was the crystal system of the framework after the phase transition at 1.35 GPa?
What was the pressure range in which the computational study was performed?
Why was paraffin used in the high-pressure experiments?
What was the significance of the angle between the indentation stress and the formate ligands?
data.answer: It influenced the mechanical anisotropy and deformation behavior of the framework

data.question: Was the PBE functional used in the computational study corrected for dispersion interactions?
Did the nanoindentation experiments reveal that the framework has intrinsic elastic anisotropy?
Was the crystal system of the framework always hexagonal throughout the experiments?
